Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 28 Sep 2018Eh don't think it's beneficial. As your corporation will be subject to tax on the dividends if I recall correctly. Best to keep it under an individual account 0 comments0

Yong Kah Hwee, Co-founder at SeedlyLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 28 Sep 2018Not sure what you mean...Do you mean buy shares from other companies? If so, you don't have to set up a company just to buy shares. You can set up an account under any local brokerages and start trading :)If you mean buy shares from your own company... Technically when you set up your own company you own 100% of your company (assuming no other investors and you use 100% your own money), so you own 100% of your own company's shares.0 comments0
